item.title: B. add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: B. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: B. add a quote by William Shatner
item.description: "I don't want people to know me. I want them to believe my version." -- William Shatner

item.title: B. add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: B. add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come." -- Matt Groening

item.title: B. add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: B. add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: B. add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: B. add a quote by Ramakrishna
item.description: "As long as I live, so long do I learn." -- Ramakrishna

item.title: B. add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: B. add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.
